alert.note: Alert for Howell; Oregon; Ozark; Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 30 at 2:56AM CDT until October 30 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29. For the second Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 22 expected. * WHERE...Howell, Shannon, Ozark and Oregon Counties. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, until 9 AM CDT this morning. For the second Freeze Warning, from 9 PM this evening to 10 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
